page.title: 04LOCAL GOVERNMENT IN CROSTON
page.content:
a){Local council nominees}must be on the electoral role or have lived and worked within 3 miles of the village for at least a year. Elections are every 4 years and 9 proposers are needed. Meetings are monthly in the Over-60's Hut.Public and Press are admitted. b){The Parish Council}is responsible for things such as public seating and siting of waste bins. The Village Green and Recreational Ground is also their responsibility. They may spend up to Â£4000 per year in Croston.
{LAW AND ORDER IN CROSTON AREA} There are two separate Police houses inhabited by rural beat officers in Croston and Eccleston. Police help is requested from Chorley by phone. The most common crime in the area is Criminal Damage.
